definition: money given to children as new year present
see 壓根兒|压根儿[ya4 gen1 r5]
to press/to push down/to keep under (control)/pressure
variant of 歲|岁[sui4], year/years old
classifier for years (of age)/year/year (of crop harvests)
surname Qian
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: They can also get some money from their parents.
sentences.chinese: 当然他们还可以拿到他们父母亲戚给的压岁钱。

sentences.english: Parents give their children lucky money in red envelopes.
sentences.chinese: 后代疏给他们的小孩儿搭著黑包的压岁钱。

sentences.english: I think it is acceptable that parents take all the New Year money from young kids.
sentences.chinese: 我认为父母拿走小孩子全部的压岁钱是能接受的。

sentences.english: During the Spring Festival, I can receive a lot of money, about 1 or 2 thousand Yuan.
sentences.chinese: 春节的时候，能收好多压岁钱。

sentences.english: Adult usually give lucky money to children during Spring Festival.
sentences.chinese: 成年人通常在春节期间给孩子们压岁钱。

sentences.english: Adults gave me many blessings, and New Year's money?
sentences.chinese: 大人们送给我很多祝福，还有压岁钱呢。

sentences.english: I like to get lucky money during Chinese New Year.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢在新年期间收到压岁钱。

sentences.english: Normally, our elders give us children new year money. We kowtow to them and give them our best wishes.
sentences.chinese: 一般是这样，家里给压岁钱就是给我们这小孩子。

sentences.english: So I should also prepare "lucky money" in China.
sentences.chinese: 那我在中国也要准备压岁钱了。

sentences.english: Jack got a lot of lucky money this Chinese New Year.
sentences.chinese: 杰克今年过年得到许多压岁钱。

sentences.english: They will give us new year money.
sentences.chinese: 磕头拜年，父母给压岁钱。

sentences.english: Liang's initial capital was the 70, 000-yuan "lucky money" that he had saved over the years.
sentences.chinese: 梁昊的原始资本是他积攒多年的7万元“压岁钱”。

definition: pocket money/allowance
pocket money/allowance/spending money
money wrapped in red as a gift/bonus payment/kickback/bribe
gift money (on the occasion of a wedding etc)
to celebrate the Chinese New Year
monetary gift
surname Qian
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
to pay a New Year call/to wish sb a Happy New Year
secret purse/secret stash of money
gift/present/CL:件[jian4],個|个[ge4],份[fen4]
cost of living/living expenses/alimony
to show filial respect/to give presents (to one's elders or superiors)/to support one's aged parents
piggy bank/coin bank/money box
year-end bonus
incidental expenses/sundries/pocket money
to get oneself a wife/to take a daughter-in-law
